headline: Continental Drifting
abstract: “Seven Worlds, One Planet,” the latest nature documentary extravaganza from the BBC Natural History Unit, offers spectacular footage and a sense of déjà vu.
lead_paragraph: Listing the nature programs narrated, and sometimes written and produced, by the extremely industrious David Attenborough would take about all the space I have here. Just listing the major ones — the Frozen Planets, the Blue Planets, the Planet Earths — would be a stretch. Within the last year, he’s added 15 more hours with the highly praised “Our Planet” for Netflix and now “Seven Worlds, One Planet,” showing on four cable networks — AMC, BBC America, IFC and Sundance — beginning Saturday.
